raw_text:
Singer Ian Brown 'in gig arrest'
 
 Former Stone Roses singer Ian Brown was arrested after a fight during a concert in San Francisco on Tuesday, his spokesman has said.
 
 A fan jumped on stage and attacked the singer, who then became involved in a fracas with a security guard, Fiction Records spokesman Paul Smernicki said. He said Brown was arrested at his hotel after the show at the Great American Music Hall but released without charge. San Francisco police said they could find no record of his arrest. Mr Smernicki said he had been told a fan "rugby-tackled" the singer during the gig, which resulted in "pushing and shoving".
 
 Brown then got into a brawl with another man who tried to restrain him - without realising he was a security guard, Mr Smernicki added. The star went off for 15 minutes before returning to finish his set. Police took witness statements and apprehended Brown at his hotel, Mr Smernicki said. But he was released without charge and "as far as we're aware, that's the end of it", Mr Smernicki added. A spokesperson for the San Francisco Police Department said he may have been detained but they could find no record of the incident. Brown, 42, was lead singer with The Stone Roses, one of the most seminal bands in British rock, until they split in 1996. He has since forged a successful solo career, scoring nine UK top 30 singles since 1998. In 1998, he was sentenced to four months in jail for using threatening behaviour towards an aeroplane captain and stewardess.
llama3.2:1b: Ian Brown, former lead singer of The Stone Roses, was arrested after a fight during a concert in San Francisco on Tuesday.
A fan attacked him on stage, resulting in pushing and shoving with security guard Paul Smernicki.
Brown became involved in the altercation and got into a brawl with another man without realizing he was a security guard.
He left for 15 minutes before returning to finish his set, which was later released without charge due to lack of evidence.

Brown then got into a brawl with another man who turned out to be a security guard.
He was arrested at his hotel but released without charge.

qwen2.5:0.5b: A singer named Ian Brown got into a fight during a concert with his band The Stone Roses.
He became involved in a brawling with a security guard who tried to stop him from leaving the stage.
When he returned, another man came up and grabbed him and tried to restrain him.
Brown didn't realize that he was being attacked by the security guard.
He got into a physical altercation with the other man who tried to stop him, without realizing it was a security guard.
Police took witness statements and apprehended him at his hotel, but he wasn't arrested and he had 15 minutes to walk off before returning and finishing his set.
The police said they could find no record of Brown's arrest.
Ian Brown, the lead singer of The Stone Roses, has since become a successful solo artist.
He scored nine UK top 30 singles since 1998 in 2014.
In 1998, he was sentenced to four months in jail for using threatening behavior towards an aeroplane captain and stewardess.
